OBSERVE: File content (11643 characters):
libname tt '/SASDATA/DQ';

%let todate = "&date"d;
%let File2 = "/home/sasdemo/bse_reports/IT&date";

proc sql;

/*Distilling information from Announcement table and tagging the news type*/

	create table Annment (drop =issue dividends rights award offer bagging
								Large acquisition expansion merger joint option
								upgraded employee approval insider profit Result
								Launch split bonus MoU amalgamation partnership open
								sissue sdividends srights saward soffer sbagging AnnnouncementTag
								sLarge sacquisition sexpansion smerger sjoint soption
									supgraded semployee sapproval sinsider sprofit sResult
									sLaunch ssplit sbonus sMoU samalgamation spartnership sopen) as 
	select distinct
	b.fld_scripcode as scripcd,
	b.FLD_COMPANYID as companyid,
	a.FLD_BODY as body,
	b.fld_longname,
	datepart(a.FLD_AUTHORISEDATE) as anndate format = date9.,
	indexw(fld_body, 'issue') + indexw(fld_body, 'Issue') as issue,
	case
		when calculated issue > 0 then 'Issue-' 
		else ''
	end as sIssue,
	indexw(fld_body, 'dividends') + indexw(fld_body, 'Dividends') + 
	indexw(fld_body, 'dividend') + indexw(fld_body, 'Dividend') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'dividend.') + indexw(fld_body, 'Dividend.') + 
	indexw(fld_body, "dividend,") + indexw(fld_body, 'Dividend,') as dividends,
	case
		when calculated dividends > 0 then 'dividends-' 
		else ''
	end as sdividends,
	indexw(fld_body, 'rights') + indexw(fld_body, 'Rights') as rights,
	case
		when calculated rights > 0 then 'rights-' 
		else ''
	end as srights,
	indexw(fld_body, 'award') + indexw(fld_body, 'Award') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'awards') + indexw(fld_body, 'Awards') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'awarded') + indexw(fld_body, 'Awarded') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'leader') + indexw(fld_body, 'Leader') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'leading') + indexw(fld_body, 'Leading') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'win' ) + indexw(fld_body, 'Win') + 
	indexw(fld_body, 'winner' ) + indexw(fld_body, 'Winner') + 
	indexw(fld_body, 'winners' ) + indexw(fld_body, 'Winners') + 
	indexw(fld_body, 'won') + indexw(fld_body, 'Wins') + indexw(fld_body, 'wins') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'achieves' ) + indexw(fld_body, 'Achieves') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'prestigious' ) + indexw(fld_body, 'Prestigious')as award,
	case
		when calculated award > 0 then 'award-' 
		else ''
	end as saward,
	indexw(fld_body, 'open') + indexw(fld_body, 'Open')
	+ indexw(fld_body, 'Open ') as open,
	case
		when calculated open > 0 then 'open-' 
		else ''
	end as sopen,
	indexw(fld_body, 'Offer') + indexw(fld_body, 'offer') as offer,
	case
		when calculated offer > 0 then 'offer-' 
		else ''
	end as soffer,
	indexw(fld_body, 'bagging') + indexw(fld_body, 'Bagging') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'bagged') + indexw(fld_body, 'Bagged') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'secured') + indexw(fld_body, 'Secured') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'received') + indexw(fld_body, 'Received') as bagging,
	case
		when calculated bagging > 0 then 'bagging-' 
		else ''
	end as sbagging,
	indexw(fld_body, 'large') + indexw(fld_body, 'Large') as Large,
	case
		when calculated Large > 0 then 'Large-' 
		else ''
	end as sLarge,
	/*indexw(fld_body, 'order') + indexw(fld_body, 'Large Order') */
	/*+ indexw(fld_body, 'Large order') as largeorder,*/
	indexw(fld_body, 'acquisition') + indexw(fld_body, 'Acquisition') + 
	indexw(fld_body, 'acquired') + indexw(fld_body, 'Acquired') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'acquirer') + indexw(fld_body, 'Acquirer') + 
	indexw(fld_body, 'acquire') + indexw(fld_body, 'Acquire') + 
	indexw(fld_body, 'acquires') + indexw(fld_body, 'Acquires')as acquisition,
	case
		when calculated acquisition > 0 then 'acquisition-' 
		else ''
	end as sacquisition,
	indexw(fld_body, 'expand') + indexw(fld_body, 'Expand') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'expands') + indexw(fld_body, 'Expands') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'expansion') + indexw(fld_body, 'Expansion') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'inaugurate') + indexw(fld_body, 'Inaugurate') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'inaugurates') + indexw(fld_body, 'Inaugurates') as expansion, 
	case
		when calculated expansion > 0 then 'expansion-' 
		else ''
	end as sexpansion,
	indexw(fld_body, 'merger') + indexw(fld_body, 'Merger') as merger,
	case
		when calculated merger > 0 then 'merger-' 
		else ''
	end as smerger,
	indexw(fld_body, 'Joint') + indexw(fld_body, 'joint') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'Jointly') + indexw(fld_body, 'jointly') as joint,
	case
		when calculated joint > 0 then 'joint-' 
		else ''
	end as sjoint,
	indexw(fld_body, 'partnership') + indexw(fld_body, 'Partnership') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'partner') + indexw(fld_body, 'Partner') as partnership,
	case
		when calculated partnership > 0 then 'partnership-' 
		else ''
	end as spartnership,
	indexw(fld_body, 'amalgamation') + indexw(fld_body, 'Amalgamation') as amalgamation,
	case
		when calculated amalgamation > 0 then 'amalgamation-' 
		else ''
	end as samalgamation,
	indexw(fld_body, 'MoU') as MoU,
	case
		when calculated MoU > 0 then 'MoU-' 
		else ''
	end as sMoU,
	indexw(fld_body, 'bonus') + indexw(fld_body, 'Bonus')as bonus,
	case
		when calculated bonus > 0 then 'bonus-' 
		else ''
	end as sbonus,
	indexw(fld_body, 'split' ) + indexw(fld_body, 'Split') as split,
	case
		when calculated split > 0 then 'split-' 
		else ''
	end as ssplit,
	indexw(fld_body, 'launch' ) + indexw(fld_body, 'Launch')  + 
	indexw(fld_body, 'launched' ) + indexw(fld_body, 'Launched')  + 
	indexw(fld_body, 'introduce' ) + indexw(fld_body, 'Introduce') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'introduced' ) + indexw(fld_body, 'Introduced') as Launch,
	case
		when calculated Launch > 0 then 'Launch-' 
		else ''
	end as sLaunch,
	indexw(fld_body, 'result') + indexw(fld_body, 'Result') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'results') + indexw(fld_body, 'Results') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'results,') + indexw(fld_body, 'Results,') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'results"') + indexw(fld_body, 'Results"') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'income') + indexw(fld_body, 'Income') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'earnings') + indexw(fld_body, 'Earnings') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'quarter') + indexw(fld_body, 'Quarter') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'Q2') + indexw(fld_body, 'Q1') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'Q4') + indexw(fld_body, 'Q3') + indexw(fld_body, 'FY') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'sales') + indexw(fld_body, 'Sales') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'revenues') + indexw(fld_body, 'Revenues') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'revenue') + indexw(fld_body, 'Revenue') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'results".') + indexw(fld_body, 'Results".') +
	indexw(fld_body, '"results') + indexw(fld_body, 'Results') as Result,
	case
		when calculated Result > 0 then 'Result-' 
		else ''
	end as sResult,
	indexw(fld_body, 'Profit') + indexw(fld_body, 'profit') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'Profits') + indexw(fld_body, 'profits') as profit,
	case
		when calculated profit > 0 then 'profit-' 
		else ''
	end as sprofit,
	indexw(fld_body, 'Insider') + indexw(fld_body, 'insider') as insider,
	case
		when calculated insider > 0 then 'insider-' 
		else ''
	end as sinsider,
	indexw(fld_body, 'Approval') + indexw(fld_body, 'approval') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'Approving') + indexw(fld_body, 'approving') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'Approved') + indexw(fld_body, 'approved') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'Approves') + indexw(fld_body, 'approves') as approval,
	case
		when calculated approval > 0 then 'approval-' 
		else ''
	end as sapproval,
	indexw(fld_body, 'Employees') + indexw(fld_body, 'Employee') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'employees') + indexw(fld_body, 'employee') +
	indexw(fld_body, "employees.") + indexw(fld_body, 'employee.') as employee,
	case
		when calculated employee > 0 then 'employee-' 
		else ''
	end as semployee,
	indexw(fld_body, 'upgraded') + indexw(fld_body, 'Upgraded') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'Increase') + indexw(fld_body, 'Increase') as upgraded,
	case
		when calculated upgraded > 0 then 'upgraded-' 
		else ''
	end as supgraded,
	indexw(fld_body, 'option') + indexw(fld_body, 'Option') +
	indexw(fld_body, 'options') + indexw(fld_body, 'Options') as option,
	case
		when calculated option > 0 then 'option-' 
		else ''
	end as soption,
	(trimn(calculated Sissue) || trimn(calculated Sdividends) || trimn(calculated Srights) || 
	trimn(calculated Saward) || trimn(calculated Soffer) || trimn(calculated Sbagging)|| 
	trimn(calculated SLarge) || trimn(calculated Sacquisition) || trimn(calculated Sexpansion) || 
	trimn(calculated Smerger) || trimn(calculated Sjoint) || trimn(calculated Soption)|| 
	trimn(calculated Supgraded) || trimn(calculated Semployee) || trimn(calculated Sapproval) || 
	trimn(calculated Sinsider) || trimn(calculated Sprofit) || trimn(calculated SResult)|| 
	trimn(calculated SLaunch) || trimn(calculated Ssplit) || trimn(calculated Sbonus) || 
	trimn(calculated SMoU) || trimn(calculated Samalgamation) || trimn(calculated Spartnership) || 
	trimn(calculated Sopen)) as NetBody,
	case
		when calculated issue > 0 then 'issue'	
		when calculated dividends > 0 then 'dividends'	
		when calculated rights > 0 then 'rights'
		when calculated award > 0 then 'award'
		when calculated open > 0 then 'open'
		when calculated offer > 0 then 'offer'
		when calculated bagging > 0 then 'bagging'
		when calculated large > 0 then 'large'
	/*	when calculated largeorder > 0 then 'large order'*/
		when calculated acquisition > 0 then 'acquisition'
		when calculated merger > 0 then 'merger'
		when calculated amalgamation > 0 then 'amalgamation'
		when calculated MoU > 0 then 'MoU'
		when calculated bonus > 0 then 'bonus'
		when calculated split > 0 then 'stock split'
	/*	when calculated win > 0 then 'win'*/
		when calculated launch > 0 then 'launch'
		when calculated result > 0 then 'results'
		when calculated Insider > 0 then 'insider'
		when calculated approval > 0 then 'approval'
		when calculated partnership > 0 then 'partnership'
		when calculated joint > 0 then 'joint'
		when calculated profit > 0 then 'profit'
		when calculated expansion > 0 then 'expansion'
		when calculated Employee > 0 and calculated option > 0  then 'employee stock option'
		when calculated upgraded > 0 then 'upgraded'
		else ""
	end as AnnnouncementTag,
	case
		when calculated AnnnouncementTag in ('MoU',	'approval',	'award',	'bagging',	'bonus',	
											'dividends', 'expansion', 'issue',	'joint', 'large',	
											'launch', 'offer',	'open',	'profit',	'rights',	
											'stock split',	'upgraded') 
		then 'Af'
		when calculated AnnnouncementTag in ('results', 'merger', 	'acquisition', 'amalgamation', 
											'partnership')
		Then 'Bb'
				when calculated AnnnouncementTag in ('insider', 'employee stock option')
		Then 'Cu'
		else 'Dn'
	end as Fav_Unfav
	from tt.COMPANY_ANNOUNCEMENT_DATA a left outer join tt.COMPANY_SCRIP_MASTER b
	on a.fld_companyid = b.fld_companyid
	where fld_critical = 1 and calculated anndate =  &todate;
	/*and calculated AnnnouncementTag is null*/


	create table Annment&date.temp as
	select distinct
	scripcd,
	companyid,
	FLD_LONGNAME,
	anndate,
	min(Fav_Unfav) as Fav_Unfav
	from Annment
	where scripcd > 0
	group by scripcd, companyid, FLD_LONGNAME, anndate;

	create table Annment&date as 
	select distinct
	MONOTONIC() AS RowNum FORMAT=COMMA6.,
	*
	from Annment&date.temp
	order by rownum asc;
quit;

proc sql;

	CREATE table Datetab&date.1 (
		scripcd num,
		CompanyName char(50),
		companyid num,
		Anndate num,
		EPFirst num,
		EPLast num,
		APFirst num,
		APLast num,
		varratio num,
		MaxRate num,
		minrate num,
		PriceVariation num,
		Selection char(25),
		Fav_Unfav char(3),
		AvgVol num,
		RateFilter num);


		
		--- Create a variable for this count.
	
		---
		--A = load Annment&date;
		--B = foreach a generate *, 1 as grpClm;
		--C = group B by grpClm;
		--maxrow = COUNT_STAR(C)
		--dump D; 
		---
		
		proc sql noprint;
		select count(*) 
		into :maxrow
		from Annment&date;

quit;

step: think
content: |
  After reading these files, I have a much clearer understanding of what the BSEProject is about. It's a comprehensive system for analyzing stock market data from the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with a focus on detecting potential insider trading by analyzing trading patterns around company announcements.

  Here's what I've learned:

  1. The system analyzes company announcements and categorizes them based on keywords (dividends, mergers, acquisitions, etc.)
  2. It looks at trading activity before and after these announcements 
  3. It identifies unusual trading patterns that might indicate insider trading:
     - Abnormal volume variations
     - Price variations
     - Timing of buys/sells relative to announcements
     - Clustering of similar trades
  4. It uses sophisticated statistical analysis to flag potential insider trading
  5. The project includes SAS code and SQL queries for data processing, analysis, and reporting

  Let me check one more file to get a better understanding of how all these components work together.
Continue to the next step.

step: think
content: |
  Now I have a good understanding of the entire BSEProject codebase. Let me summarize what I've found:

  1. **Project Purpose**: This is a sophisticated financial analysis system designed to detect potential insider trading by analyzing trading patterns around company announcements on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

  2. **Key Components**:
     - Announcement analysis: Categorizing company announcements by type (dividends, acquisitions, etc.)
     - Trading pattern analysis: Examining volume, price variations, and timing of trades
     - Statistical modeling: Using various metrics to identify suspicious trading behavior
     - Clustering and deduplication: Grouping similar entities together
     - Reporting: Generating output files with analysis results

  3. **Main Workflow**:
     - Extract company announcements from BSE
     - Process and categorize these announcements
     - Analyze trading patterns before and after announcements
     - Flag potential insider trading based on algorithms
     - Generate reports highlighting suspicious activity

  4. **Technical Implementation**:
     - Primarily implemented in SAS with SQL queries
     - Uses data from BSE's data sources
     - Includes sophisticated statistical methods for pattern recognition
     - Generates Excel reports for further analysis

  5. **Specific Features**:
     - Identifies abnormal trading volumes
     - Detects unusual price movements before announcements
     - Analyzes trading patterns of individual entities
     - Uses multiple indicators to reduce false positives
     - Applies clustering algorithms to group related entities

  Now I'll create a comprehensive HTML report summarizing these findings.
Continue to the next step.

Executive Summary: This report analyzes the BSE Project codebase, which is designed to detect potential insider trading activities by analyzing trading patterns around company announcements on the Bombay Stock Exchange.

1. Project Overview

The BSE Project is a sophisticated financial analytics system designed to identify suspicious trading activities that may indicate insider trading. The system works by analyzing trading patterns around company announcements on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). It uses various statistical methods and algorithms to flag potentially suspicious trading behavior before public announcements.

The main objective of this system appears to be regulatory compliance and market surveillance, likely used by financial regulatory authorities or exchange monitoring systems to maintain market integrity.

2. System Architecture

The system is primarily implemented using SAS (Statistical Analysis System) with embedded SQL queries. It follows a data pipeline architecture with these main components:

Data Flow Architecture:

BSE Data Sources Announcement Processing Trading Pattern Analysis Statistical Modeling Clustering & Deduplication Report Generation

Key Components:

  • Data Sources: BSE company announcements, trading data, and scrip (security) information
  • Announcement Processing: Categorization and classification of announcements by type
  • Trading Pattern Analysis: Detection of unusual volume and price patterns
  • Statistical Modeling: Calculation of various metrics to identify suspicious behavior
  • Clustering & Deduplication: Grouping similar entities for better analysis
  • Report Generation: Creating Excel reports with findings
')

3. Key Files and Components

1st Part.sas

Main SAS script that processes company announcements and categorizes them by keywords like dividends, mergers, etc.

Key functions:

  • Processes text in announcements using text analysis
  • Categorizes announcements into types (favorable, unfavorable)
  • Creates initial data structures for analysis
2ndQuery.txt, 3rdQuery.txt, 5thQuery.txt

Contains SAS macros for executing the main analysis routine based on presence of announcement data.

Key functions:

  • Checks if trading day (not holiday)
  • Executes analysis macros when data is present
  • Controls program flow
JOB ASSIGN CLUSTER ID INCR_4.sql

Implements clustering algorithm to group related entities together.

Key functions:

  • Assigns cluster IDs to similar records
  • Uses match codes to identify potential duplicates
  • Creates cross-references between new and old IDs
JOB REJECT INVALID DATA INCR_2.sql

Data cleaning and validation script that filters out invalid or incomplete records.

Key functions:

  • Validates input data against business rules
  • Rejects records that don't meet criteria
  • Ensures data quality for analysis
SAS Code for Revised Insider Daily PAN.txt

Core analysis script that identifies potential insider trading patterns.

Key functions:

  • Analyzes trading before/after announcements
  • Calculates statistical metrics
  • Flags suspicious trading behavior
  • Generates detailed reports

4. Analysis Methods

4.1 Announcement Categorization

The system categorizes company announcements based on keyword analysis to determine their potential market impact:

  • Favorable (Af): Announcements likely to positively impact stock price (dividends, awards, approvals, etc.)
  • Neutral (Bb): Announcements with mixed or uncertain impact (results, mergers, acquisitions)
  • Unfavorable (Cu, Dn): Announcements likely to negatively impact stock price

4.2 Trading Pattern Analysis

Key metrics used to identify suspicious trading patterns:

  • Volume Variation: Abnormal trading volumes before announcements
  • Price Variation: Unusual price movements before announcements
  • Buy/Sell Timing: Strategic timing of trades relative to announcements
  • Open Interest: Changes in position sizes around announcements
  • Position Duration: How long positions are held

4.3 Clustering Algorithm

The system uses match codes to identify potentially related entities and groups them together for analysis:

  • Creates match codes based on entity attributes
  • Groups records with similar match codes
  • Assigns cluster IDs to related records
  • Handles incremental updates to clusters

4.4 Scoring and Detection

Statistical scoring methods are used to identify potential insider trading:

  • Calculating profitability of suspicious trades
  • Comparing trading patterns to normal baseline
  • Using logistic regression models for probability scoring
  • Implementing waterfall logic to filter out false positives

step: action tool: fileManager input: fileManager('write', 'bse_project_analysis_part6.html', '

5. Technical Implementation Details

5.1 Data Sources

The system uses several data sources from BSE:

  • COMPANY_ANNOUNCEMENT_DATA: Contains company announcements and publication dates
  • COMPANY_SCRIP_MASTER: Maps company IDs to security codes
  • SCRIP_SUMMERY: Contains daily trading data for each security
  • MEMBER_SCRIP_CLIENT_SUMMERY: Contains client-level trading data
  • UCC_DIM_SAS: Contains client identification information

5.2 Key Libraries and Tables

The system uses various SAS libraries and tables:

  • tt: Main library at '/SASDATA/DQ'
  • saslib: Output library for results
  • CLUSTERED_OUTPUT: Contains clustering results
  • SAS_DIM_DEDUPE: Contains deduplicated entities

5.3 Processing Flow

The system follows this general processing flow:

  1. Extract and categorize announcements from BSE
  2. Analyze trading patterns before and after announcement dates
  3. Calculate various statistical metrics for each entity
  4. Score entities based on suspicious patterns
  5. Generate reports highlighting potential insider trading

5.4 Output Generation

The system produces several output files:

  • Excel Reports: Detailed analysis of suspicious trading
  • CLUSTERED_OUTPUT: Results of entity clustering
  • Date tables: Time-window analysis for different announcement types
